result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob R. LaPenta was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: with Huber privileges.   IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward any and all outstanding restitution, fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-----------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Not to possess any prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
-----------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
-----------------------------

timeConds.notes: The defendant is to complete a total of forty (40) hours of community service work during the period of probation WITHOUT buyout option.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jacob R. LaPenta in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

Defendant Jacob R. LaPenta in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond remains.  Minutes filed.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jacob R. LaPenta in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defendant Jacob R. LaPenta appeared, Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond remains.  Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH VICTIM M.L.T BY ANY MEANS.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant Jacob R. LaPenta appeared, Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.  Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
